abstract: As Bank of America scrambled this week to appoint a new chief executive, one of the bank’s longtime soldiers — Brian T. Moynihan — stood by ready to take a job that others had turned down.
snippet: As Bank of America scrambled this week to appoint a new chief executive, one of the bank’s longtime soldiers — Brian T. Moynihan — stood by ready to take a job that others had turned down.
lead_paragraph: As Bank of America scrambled this week to appoint a new chief executive, one of the bank’s longtime soldiers — Brian T. Moynihan — stood by ready and willing to take a job that others had turned down.

headline.main: BofA’s New Chief Got Job When Others Fell Away
